description:
My girlfriend and I took a stroll in here after dim sum nearby. I was immediately drawn to their colorful fortunate cookies and my girlfriend and her husband was also going to get a bag until they spotted a container next to the register labeled "Reject Fortune Cookies" Hahahaha! We were done!! It was very funny, because not only did the bag contain some broken cookies,imperfect cookies , some pieces were just flat (like they didn't even bother folding the cookies at all) haha hilarious). Naturally we had to get both. 

We all walked out happy. 

Service was what you would expect from the other reviewers. The man begins the register wasn't rude, didn't make small talk or asked us any questions. So I guess it really should be a 3.5 but given that we didn't have a bad experience I can't really ding them. 

Also, they make GIANT Custom fortunate cookies!  I didn't ask how big they could make them but there's a sign that says they're the home of the Giant Fortune Cookies! 

Cheers!
author: Nancy N.

description:
Cow ears. Cow ears. Give me 10 bags please. I'm not sure why but in the last 25 years I've only had these delicious, yummy, crunchy BETTER than chips cow ears twice.

These use to be my childhood favourite treats but there's no where to buy them except here and oh in Asia. 

They're so good I ate a whole bag, I think they have a limit of how many you can purchase. I don't think they should limit it though, you know, in life, you snooze you lose. First come first serve kinda thing. 

Nonetheless, next time I'm in SF I'm gonna stock up and buy them all!! JKJK. I can't afford the calories so 1 indulgence is good enough.
author: Jae L.

description:
This place is known for their famous cow ear cookies. I waited in line for 2 hours just to buy some. Gave them a $10 bill but he claimed that it's not passing through his FBI counterfeit money machine. Asked me for another bill so I gave him a $50 dollar bill...apparently it's doing the same thing. After 10 minutes of running it over and over again, he finally decides to accept the $50 vs the $10. 

Tip: they only sell them at 2PM. Go earlier to stand in line or else you will not get any.
author: C B.

description:
Never goes back again, never seen people so
Rude, never seen service so terrible like this bakery. I was txting with my mom asking how many bags of cookies she wants, and then I told the cashier I want four bags. the ladies who on the cashier was so rude and said"you are on your phone and I don't want to talk to you." Then my friend said"She is asking her mom" she replied again"I don't care, I don't want to talk to you, I don't know what you want" then I said please give me four bags of cookies and she was so rude again said"I don't understand, you are on your phone." Omg, that moment I feeling I went to a black market bakery.
author: Rebecca Z.

description:
Walking around Chinatown, we came across Mee Mee Bakery.

Family wanted to check it out, so here we are. They had a nice variety of baked goods at very reasonable prices. This place won't hurt your wallet. Employees are friendly enough and quick. Tried a few things from here and enjoyed the consistency of everything, flavor wise, it could have been better. No seating available here, just get your goodies and go.
author: Kimberly J.

description:
I really had no idea about their "Cow Ears" cookies until my wife told me about it. Honestly, I am a sucker for going to mom and pa business because I grew up in a mom and pa restaurant business myself. 
I am very disappointed when I went into the store. This place totally lack simple common human courtesy.  The guy in his late forties treats you like a life long enemy.  

Did I get my "Cow Ears" cookies ?  Answer:   No.  
Do I really care ?  Answer : No 
Is this place worth going to ?  Yes, I find it very entertaining to see a grown man throwing a temper tantrum when you ask him : "Do you have any "Cow Ears" cookies ?" ( If you don't believe me, try asking him yourself next time you go to San Francisco)
author: Peter W.

description:
I am prejudiced towards old time family businesses, probably because of family history.  Immigrants coming to a country not knowing anyone, the local language, nor having financial means to start a business, just satisfied with making ends meet.  Underdogs indeed.

In Chinatown, word travels fast these days especially food wise.  There is an alley location fortune cookie factory that is more famous and definitely tourist friendly.  This low key spot next to the Chinatown Walgreens beeped on my radar due to chatter about a place on Stockton Street that garnered lines, a rarity these days in these parts.  

When I walked in on a weekday morning, there was no one at the counter, just a gentleman inside the baking area pouring ingredients.  After studying their counter offerings for a few minutes, he walked out and asked how can he help me.  Besides grabbing a bag of flat fortune cookies and a bag of "defective" cookies, I asked him for a pineapple moon cake (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=v7Q4km8lHwHiMr2DtWrztQ&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q).  I also asked about the item that prompted this visit and he told me to come back at noon.

After paying for my sweets, he gave me the inside tip on how to ensure that I get this item which I asked a coworker to help me with a few days later.  Following his instructions, I soon had a bag of what everyone sought:  cow ears (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=vKIzzTpyJf44rCbcqDqCWg&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q).  I actually scored two bags as I gave one to my parents.  

My lesson from this was that cow ears are okay in my palate but I wouldn't particularly crave them.  Three stars on the food and one big star for the gentleman for the helpful advice.
author: Mike C.

description:
This place is my favorite fortune cookie store EVER! I used to frequent SF every summer growing up and would always stop by this place for fortune cookies, almond cookies, and cow ears! To this day I believe that fortune cookies are THE MOST UNDERRATED COOKIE EVER!

This store is authentic and delicious. Walking up to the door the fresh cookie aroma makes my mouth water. There is a occasionally a short line because this place is so popular. The owners are really great and helpful with ordering. 

Definitely recommend trying the almond cookies and cow ears, but I could eat an entire bag of coin cookies in one sitting. 

Side note: my friends really do call me Cookie Monster. I know a thing or two about sweets.
author: Crystal E.

description:
What the actual F-CK?! 

My mom specifically asked me to come to this place to get several bags of Cow Ear Snackers for her and some friends. 

Walked in here and asked if they sold them here. That b-tch ass cashier lady yelled at me "YEAH WE DO, $10!!!!"

So I thought she was having a bad day or whatever, I asked her for 10 bags and this b-tch had the nerve to yell at me and give me the dirtiest look imaginable and screamed "NO STUPID ASIAN AMERICAN (in Toi San)! ONLY TWO BAGS FOR $10 PER PERSON!" 

WTF YO?! 

She had stacks on stacks of Cow Ear Snackers laid out through out her shop!

This b-tch and her whole family are relentless!!! Her husband and son are the exact same way! 

F-CK THIS PLACE AND THEIR COW EARS! THEY'RE NOT EVEN GOOD! 

In all honesty, the entire SF Chinatown has the worst Chinese people ever! They're all so f-cking disrespectful! It made me miss LA even more! 

I hope this place shuts down ASAP!!! 

How TF do they have 3 stars?!? F-CK?! 

If it wasn't for my moms request to get these dumb Snackers, I wouldn't have known about this place, nor would I ever come to CT here. 

NEVER HAVE I EVER BEEN SO ANGRY AT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!
author: Katie L.

description:
The RUDEST man I have ever met works here.
 
Went to San Francisco and the husband wants me to come pick up some cow ears crackers for his parents.  I quickly googled it and it brought me to this place.  The husband drops me off and tries to find parking in Chinatown (everyone knows how difficult it is).  I walk into the store and I stand there for a while as I see an older man on the side packing some cow ears in bags.  

He doesn't greet me, just continues to pack them into the bags.  After about 5 minutes, I walk over there and ask if I can buy some cow ears crackers.  He says that its not for sale right now and to come back at 2pm.  I'm a little annoyed as I can see him packing it right then and there.  Its only 1:15pm.  My husband couldn't find parking, so we decide to go to the Ferry Marketplace to check it out before coming back to Chinatown.  I got back to the store at 2:30pm after I get dropped off.  I nicely asked the same man if I can buy cows ears crackers.  He then rudely snapped, "Come back at 3pm."  Annoyed (because this is my 2nd trip back to Chinatown), I said, "You told me to come back at 2pm."  He then yelled, "Don't be late next time! Its all sold out. Come back at 3pm."  At this point, I'm shocked and left the shop.  

I eventually come back at 3pm (I already wasted so much time- I better get these damn cow ears).  He's still sitting at the side packing the crackers in different bags and doesn't acknowledge me.  

At this time, other customers come in asking for cow ears crackers, and he abruptly tells them that they are sold out and to come back tomorrow.  After standing there for 15-20 minutes, he finally acknowledges me, and sells the 4 bags that I ask for.  I pay, get my crackers, and leave.  No thank you or anything.  

I hear that sometimes they sell these same cow ear crackers at the Fortune Cookie Company.  Next time, I will definitely check out that place instead of bringing these rude people any business.
author: Aurora W.

description:
I went to Mee Mee Bakery for the cow ears.   I've also bought their sesame cookies in the past.   All very good products.    

I hate to be that reviewer that gives a bad rating based on one visit but come on now!   I was there to spend money and why did you proceed to act like I was an inconvenience in your day.   What happened to the old days when I could walk in there and receive a friendly greeting.   

Went in today to buy cow ears and the person in front stopped me with not a hello but a "hey you can't walk any closer" and by the way I'm going to push this cart in front of you to stop you further.   At this point I should have walked out but I really wanted those cow ears.   

Not very friendly and probably the last time I buy stuff there.   I'll take my business to Far East and Golden Gate.
author: Gary L.

description:
What you need to know: 
- This old-school bakery is most famous for their "cow ear" snacks, which are sold at 12:00pm and 2:00pm.  They sell out quickly as a line can always be found during those times. 
- The day I went, it was nearly 3:00pm and the owner said that people wouldn't leave, so they packaged more "cow ear" snacks - but this seemed very rare. 
- Yes, the customer service can be lacking, but you also have to understand that the customers are extremely pushy as well.  I had a lovely exchange with the man behind the counter and he calmly explained the times and why he got upset with the people who were trying to cut the line. 
- I, personally, don't like the "cow ear" snacks but my colleague told me that this is the closest she has ever tasted of a Toi San childhood memory/snack.  No other bakery in NYC and SF makes these anymore. So BRAVO to this bakery for maintaining an old tradition and for briefly bringing people's happy childhood memories back! 

What I ordered: 
- The famous "cow ear" snacks - The price of each bag is $5 and each person is limited to 2 bags.  There will be a line, but the wait seems to be worth it!  People, in the line, know that this product is good and proudly give these as gifts to visiting friends and family. 
- I think the trick is to kill them with kindness, hopefully they will return the favor to you!
author: Karen L.

description:
I am truly entertained by the reviews of the owners of these small mom and pop shops. This place like Liguria Bakery had me eager to meet the Wizard of Oz...I mean the owner of the Mee Mee.  

Speaking of Mee Mee..waiting in the line for this place made me want to go Mee Mee but I was hopeful the pay off (Cow Ears) would be worht it. 

The owner was cool to me just like the owner of Liguria Bakery but I guess other's have different experiences. 

You are limited to purchasing two bags (which nearly everyone gets) so I felt the peer pressure to snag two. Each bag cost FIVE BUCKS (cash only I believe).

So I had high expectations and didn't even open up the bag until I got home so I could share the treasure with the Fam. 

It wasn't that good to me...I can't explain it but I don't get the hype for this place at least. The wifey liked them and she gladly said she'd finish the bag but this treat wasn't for me.
I like lists what can I say? 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the SF Bakeries I've visited and I indicated what they're known for or a dish I recommend:

Rod's SF Bakery rankings (and what they're known for or what I like). ?) Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.

34 Panaderia La Mexicana=mexican sweet bread
35 Hot cookie=Cookies
36 Les Gourmands Bakery=Croissant
37 Mee Mee Bakery=Cow ears
author: Rod M.

description:
I gave 2 stars because of the COW Ear cookies (rated 5 stars for the taste) really great. This shop kind of mix feeling for me. They sell fortunes cookies and prices is not cheap too. Some people do consider it as great price. Saw lot of people lining up on Sat and they told me the store will start selling COW Ear cookies at 2 pm. They have limit 2 packs only per person and price is $5 per pack. She is one of the rudest owner lady I have seen. 

Previously I went to this shop interested to buy cup cake but fold they have mold already. I would never go there to buy any cake since they are not famous for cake. 

I will definite back again for the COW Ear
author: Ray K.

description:
Golden Gate Fortune Cookie Factory was recommended by my coworker, but I didn't get to go there. She said they have chocolate fortune cookies and I've never heard of such a thing.

As I was walking through china town I saw COLORED FORTUNE COOKIES at a window display! I stopped and went in, grabbed a big bag for $5... opened it to try it, I was impressed. I like fortune cookies and this was different. 

I'm glad I stopped here!
author: Jovete E.

description:
This place is known for their "Cow Ear Cookies" aka Smackers.  While these cookies are tasty, they are not exactly award-winning but rather just another item in the snack world.  

Be forewarned, the service here is EXTREMELY poor.  If you are there hoping to buy the Smackers, keep in mind you are limited to only two bags per person; and they won't sell them to you until it's 2 pm.  The fat guy behind the counter is one rude massive person.  He hardly acknowledged me when I politely (and I really mean politely.  I am not making this up just to make my review believable) asked him a question.  I, as one of the customers stood in line patiently until 2 pm came around, but by 2:05, fat guy still ignored us.  Not sure why he was so strict with his rule with the customers, but sets double-standard for himself.  Maybe he was trying to pretend he is with Golden Gate Bakery.  

Would I go again to Mee Mee Bakery?  Maybe.  That "maybe" is only if I had promised to bring some of these "Is it really worth the hassle" Smackers to a friend who has never tried them, otherwise, it's a big "HELL NO!"  

Take this, fat guy.   Stop snacking on those Smackers.
author: Susan K.

description: The store doesn't close till 6 and the person inside didn't acknowledge me until I knocked on the door several times. So I asked my daughter to call the store and he was rude and disrespectful towards her. He has lost our business.
author: Joe C.

description: If there's a 0 star. I would give them -0 star review.   This bakery should not be in business.  I was there with my mom and witnessed the guy  gave the couple of elder customers bad attitude also screamed at them. So cocky. I confronted the guy and told him to shut the f up and f off.  I just walked out the door with my mom after.  If not the customers. You wouldn't be in business Mee.  People should boycott this bakery.  Disrespect  the elderlies.   They all have the attitude problems.  F u mee
author: Mike L.

description: Not sure why my sister likes the cow ears so much. She must have been a peasant in her past life. The owner is rude. Think asian Roseanne Barr. Minus the humor.
author: Rich L.

description:
RUDE. RUDE. RUDE. 

LACK OF RESPECT. 

I came in with my family following a recommendation by a friend because my dad really likes the "cow ear" cookies. Do note that they are limited to 2  bags per person (but we did not know this as it was our first time coming). My dad grabbed two bags and walked to the counter to ask if my brother and sister could get an additional two bags.

THE LADY GRABBED THE BAGS OUT OF MY DAD'S HAND AND TOLD HIM, "IF YOU DON'T WANT TO BUY THEM, YOU DON'T HAVE TO." 

That was completely uncalled for. My dad asked a simple, innocent, harmless question and in return, the store lady bellowed a rude comment in front of my younger siblings. As young as they are, they said she was "100000% the rudest person I have ever met in my life." 

To the rude, relentless family that owns this store: please be respectful to other families.
author: Michelle H.

description: My friend warned me that these people are extremely rude.  I decided to give them the benefit of the doubt and boy do I regret it.  They are so rude that they limit the number of bags of cookies they will sell per person. Are you kidding me? Is my money less worthy than the next person?  They don't even pretend to be courteous.  Their cookies aren't all that. Not worth the frustration of being treated like dirt.  Move on!
author: Caroline C.

description:
COW EARS are the die for at Mee Mee Bakery. And if it wasn't for its killer deliciousness, I would never come back here again. Why?? Because the owners are some of the RUDEST people I had ever encountered. Literally, the first time my friends and I came, they sounded super impatient and were talking at us instead of talking to us. We felt very insulted. And the second time when my friend and I called them, they were equally as rude and ended up hanging up on us. And if the cow ears could be bought elsewhere with just a teeny better customer service, I would say bye bye to this location.

But no, only here, and I have to admit it's super good. I would say the cow ears are some of the best MUNCHING snacks in the world so far. My friends ordered dozens of bags on our first visit. But we had to preorder it and come back the next day, or whenever we can. Since the bakery store is super busy making all the fortune cookies delivers to probably hundreds of restaurant around SF, in store order would come second, I guess. 

Parking. Ah, there is a problem. Well the Bay Area is known for their difficult in finding parking spots, especially in Chinatown. All street parking, and if you're lucky, it'll probably take you about 20 minutes at least. But hopefully you do get very lucky. But yes, just prepare to be be insulted when you call or visit in person. They'll brush you off like bugs.
author: Allen W.

description: The Cow Ear cookies that everyone talks about are actually that good - we bought four bags (max 2 per person) and finished a bag ourselves in one night. The bakery seems to be owned by one family, as we were greeted by the same guy in the front both times we went. He was friendly when we first visited and let us know to come back at 4pm. He recognized us the second time we went back a few days later to buy some more. A quick in-and-out kind of purchase, great Cow Ear cookies that are super addictive!
author: Cindy C.

description: I came here for their well known "Cow Ear Cookies" Smackers. I walked in not knowing about the 2bag limit and they are extremely rude about it. A "2 bag per person" would suffice instead of calling us "selfish"
author: Marco M.

description:
This witch aka female owner. 

The moment we walked in she automatically accused my mother of having already come in and have purchased the cow ears. You promptly yelled at my mother, "You came in already, GO AWAY!" She proceeds to help me and I told her my mother is with me. 

She tosses 2 bags of Cow Ears at me. 

"Ten Dollars!" 

My mom hands her the money. 

"OKAY! You have your 2 bags. 

I was in total shock, my jaws dropped and my mom just took the bags and left. This is exceptional customer service. Her husband's back faced is the entire time. I heard she's a fake a church lady. Probably will go to Hell.
author: Margherita S.

description: best fortune cookies in the city.  hands down.  i've been going to this bakery for decades.
author: Lisa Y.

description: insane bakery! uncultured swines are rude and try to act elitist with their broken toi mountain english. cashier is a little b*tch and screams at people like dogs. have no respect for human beings. cow ears taste like fakeass sh*t, made me throw up. must have used dirty oils and monosodium glutamate. overpriced insane scam
author: Kevin R.

description:
SUPER SUPER RUDE !RUDE ! RUDE ! 
Really don't want you guys to experience this . Went there on Saturday around 2:40 pm, we were not quite sure how to call the cow ear cracker at that moment  , so we just told the cashier we want 2 backs of the cracker in the red pastiche bags , the OLD STORE LADY  event said " there is no red bags in the store, we dun have red bag , what are u talking about " WITH HER SUPER POKER FACE , I was a bit annoyed , then I explain to her  "the cracker in the red plastic bag in the back " , that Damn old women gave me a stupid response : I DONT HAVE ANYTHING BEHIND ME . I was like .... excuse me are you blind or what !? the cracker was literarily behind her !  Then she walked around ignored us for a long time . Without any smile like shxt , no more next time .
author: Key w.

description:
This place gets a bad rap bc it is a mom and pop store and it isn't anything like Golden Gate Fortune Cookie. It is a no frill bakery so don't expect exceptional service and butt kissing owners. I frequent this place because their fortune cookies are hella better than Golden Gate Fortune Cookies. 
They're crunchy and thicker than GGFC. The flavor is real good. It is ALMOST (almost) similar to the taste of a waffle/sugar cone. When they're making fresh cookies, you can smell them when you walk in. I like buying the bags of rejects. They cost less and they're either not folded correctly or the edges are not complete because the batter dispenser ran out and the cookie is jagged or not completely round.  Some cookies have fortunes in them  but are not folded neatly. They don't taste any different from the normal /pretty ones. Once in awhile  I will buy the small flat round bite sized bags. They are the perfect bite-size pieces. They're like eating chips. They disappear fast. Also, there are adult-rated/rated -X fortune cookies and flavored fortune cookies-strawberry and chocolate. The rated-x ones have corny fortunes. They're pretty dumb. The flavored ones are different. I prefer the original vanilla flavor. Strawberry taste like Strawberry Quik. Chocolate is good if you like anything choc. 

Their cow ear cookies are real popular too   I don't care for them and it is a only  because we grew up eating them a lot. The checkerboard cookies are good along with their butter cookies. 

Definitely try their fortune cookies. Just remember to not expect excellent customer service and smiles from the owner himself. However, the younger guy and lady are nicer & approachable.
author: Jen G.

description: Just plain rude. The lady YELLED, SHOUTED AND LITERALLY SCREAMED AT ME when I did nothing wrong. I just wanted to buy some cow ear cookies.
author: Connie C.

description: These people have a bad attitude, I drove all the way from Sacramento, because my friends like their cow ear cookie, but owners tell you to come back tomorrow I saw them have tons of cookie that in stock, I went this place twice, they are very rude to the customer, I won't go back their again, never ever..I rather go to Golden State Bakery down the street.they don't deserve any star.
author: Maggie C.

description: Finally got my cow ear cookies! We went on Thursday at 12:45pm. No wait. The guy was nice. Fast transaction. Tasty cookies. I finished a bag already. Don't call ahead to see if they're open - I tried that and their phone goes straight to voicemail which duped me several times because the guy goes, "Mee Mee Bakery..... *Please leave a message, etc* and I always say hi after 'bakery'! ‍ I've also randomly driven by and they were closed. So... luck was on our side this time! Yay!
author: Christine C.

description: Last time I tried buy over 20 bags of cow ears they told me to call ahead. I tried calling and the answering machine said they cannot take a call. I can't remember if I can leave a message. I went to their website and there was an email address for orders. I emailed on a Tuesday asking for over 20 bags and asked if I could pick it up that day. They said no. Then I asked if I could pick it up on Friday. They never responded. I tried again a couple of days later. Still no response. Now it's Friday night. They never reached out. This was supposed to be taken to Chicago as a Christmas gift. I live all the way in the east bay so it's not easy to go to the store hence why I tried ordering ahead. I wish they would take online orders.
author: Soo C.

description: Makes no sense to have customers come back  at a certain time for the cow ear if there are bags and bags ready to go. Apparently they only sell that when the owner is there... Way to do business!
author: X H.

description:
Guess I was lucky.  I've been coming to this place since I was a kid but haven't been here for more than 20 years.  I have been taking out of town visitors to Golden Gate Bakery Fortune Factory because they put on a good "show" of making cookies for visitors.  Only thing I noticed was their fortune cookie/chips have nasty aftertaste to them so I thought I would take some friends further up to Stockton street and try out Mee Mee Bakery. 

WOW what a difference.  It was not only a little cheaper, but much better tasting with ZERO after taste.  Sure they don't have stagged production line to entertain customers (and have reported poor service - I did not experience) but if you want some old school FC you've got to come to this place!
author: Terry T.

description:
As other people on here have said, the people here are super rude. I would not come here aside from my mom asking for cow ear cookies. They have no sense of customer service whatsoever. I had emailed them (from their website it says this is how you order) and told them I'd like 10 bags and would be there on Wednesday to pay and pick them up. When I arrived he said they never got the email, but would be able to give me 10 bags but would have to prepare and bag them as well. I asked him simply how long it would take (my cousin had picked up 9 backs 2 weeks prior and she had to come back  3 hours later). He rudely said to me "How long do you think it takes to bag 10?" Taken aback, I told him I had no clue and then he interrupted me and said that he didn't know either and that it would take time. He then went to the back and proceeded to bag. I took this as a sign that there were enough cow ear snacks to bag 10, and waited near the register. 
After he finished, he told me that I needed to do it correctly and purchase online --I told him his site said the online shop was not available and that I had to email, which I did. He then told me that I have to state I am "purchasing" it......I don't get it. I didn't want to dilly dally and aruge with him so I told him that I would keep that in mind next time. He replied and told me "You're lucky today we had enough" .....
author: Shannon N.

description: I wish I could give them zero stars.  They were so mean to my mother in law.  As a business owner myself I don't usually wish others misfortune but that's how I felt after leaving this place.
author: Francis T.

description: Been eating/buying the "coin" fortune cookies here for decades! Mee Mee IS THE BEST fortune cookie factory EVER and today I discovered SEAWEED "coin" cookies! Wow! These are so light, crispy and crunchy with a tiny bit of salty seaweed flavor!  Oishiii!!! Not quite O-Senbei but VERY light and delicious as a snack or with tea or coffee! Going to buy more as gifts soon!!! Thank You Mee Mee for existing since my childhood!!! You're THE BEST in the WORLD!!! I bought 4 - 1lb coin cookie bags today and 1 seaweed coin cookie bag today!!!
author: Aaa T.

description: Fuck this place. The boss is an arrogant asshole and his wife or whoever that lady that works there is a total bitch. My bfs mom, my sister and I tried to buy Cow Ears for OTHER people in LA and the boss and lady did not sell it to us since we were a "family". What kind of rule is that. Never coming back here again. Fuck you boss! :) Don't worry we will spread the shitty customer service experience like fire around. Go to hell !
author: Mimi W.

description:
Raise your hand if you have been personally victimized by the register lady at Mee Mee Bakery.

As other reviewers have pointed out, to put it mildly, the register lady Mee Mee Bakery makes Regina George look like blessed Mother Theresa. Look, I know Chinese service can sometimes be considered abrupt but I would rarely call it rude. The register lady's actions at Mee Mee Bakery were borderline demonic.

My poor father was taunted for being soft-spoken. The lady repeatedly yelled at him "I can't hear you" when they were literally across from each other. 

There were also bags of cow ears behind the counter, which my dad had no idea what they were called at the time. So she quite literally sneered and taunted "If you don't know what it's called, I'm not getting it for you". That was the last straw and my normally reserved dad barked back "There's no need to be rude". I ain't no wolf on Wall Street, but refusing to sell goods seems rather counterintuitive. 

To be serious though, I want to empathize for a moment. I don't think anyone ever becomes like this without some terrible life experiences to fuel that kind of anger and hate. And for that, I feel sorry, but taking it out on customers is not the smartest outlet for your frustrations.

Obviously, we won't be coming back. And if you end up having similar experiences, we should like start a support group or something.
author: Willa P.

description: I went to get four bags of cow ears (they are cookies not legit cow ears) and he said two per customer. So I asked if I could tell my friend to come in to get two more. He said no because you wouldn't get any. So when my friend went he told her it was sold out when I could see there was more behind the counter. So rude. So I'm assuming there's a limited amount of walk in sales? I'm not sure but he was very rude.
author: Anna Q.

description:
Service SUCKS!  I got a request for cow ear cookies from a visitor from New York who specifically asked me to buy her some cookies from this bakery.  

After reading the reviews on this place, I walked in with trepidation expecting the worst BUT hoping for the best and unfortunately, I can confirm the rude, indifferent attitude of the customer service at this place.

Guy was packing the cow ears cookies into bags (yah, FRESH!!) when we walked in and told us the packages weren't ready yet and to come back.  My companion, who speaks fluent Cantonese, said we were flying out today (ok, white lie!) and can we please buy some now without coming back later.  

He relented (did speaking Cantonese to him made a difference?  Hmmm!) and asked us how many bags did we want.  I said 4 bags but he would only sell us 2 bags @ $4.50/each bag.

WTF?? We had cash on hand ready to buy, he had the bags of cow ear cookies ready to sell and decided to limit us to TWO bags?  

Anyway, I told my companion that we CAN argue that there's two of us so two bags EACH would net us 4 cow ear cookie bags total but I decided to skip the confrontation as it's not worth my time and effort.

Anyway, if NOT the specific request to purchase cow ear cookies at this place, I would NOT come back.  Ever.  

There's Golden Gate Fortune Cookies on Ross alley where you can get most of the same items (I love their fortune cookies rounds!) from employees who truly value their customers.

Mee Mee Bakery clearly sees their customers as an annoyance to their retail business and it shows: the shop was empty when my companion and I visited them on 01/17/17 around 12:20 pm.
author: Mike Y.

description: Wow. I can't even explain how rude the workers are here. The only thing I like here and come here for are the cow ear cookies. Every time I come here the man in the front is nothing but rude. Since they are always sold out of the cow ear cookies, there's no reason to come back. Everything else is mediocre.
author: Connie N.

description:
Lady behind the register was so rude. Tried to ask her if they sold cow ears here because they weren't at the front display. I asked her while she was typing in the numbers for another customer. She barked at me "can't you see I'm helping another customer?" I didn't mind waiting but it was a simple question of yes or no because I was wandering for an hour already around Chinatown trying to find cow ears. I just didn't want to waste more time at a bakery if they didn't sell it! She could've told me to wait until after the transaction but she just shooed me away with her hands
Also came here previously a year ago and tried asking the lady in Chinese about the fortune cookies. She also yelled at me "I don't speak Chinese!" Wtf? We were in Chinatown and most vendors are more comfortable with customers speaking Chinese so I thought it would be appropriate but I guess it doesn't apply to this store.
Left both times without anything from this bakery because her rude ass tone of voice and service isn't worth any of the products.
author: Dana L.

description: This is the rudest bakery I have ever walked into, the old hag behind the counter is rude, senile and everything else you could imagine in a cranky old Chinese lady. They hand out the cow ears at 12:00, 2 per person at $5. If you want more than 2 you need to call 2 weeks in advance for an order. Even though I was with my brother she made him get in line and pay for it himself, like are you freaking blind or something? Her husband or the other cranky Asian guy that works behind the counter is the same way always complaining about how they don't want to sell out...well if you don't wanna sell out early then shouldn't you make some more? They lack common sense and mannerisms.
author: Janet L.

description: As the other reviews say, this place is renowned for their cow ear cookies, the best in Chinatown. Not only was the woman behind the counter rude, but she blatantly lied to me. I tried to buy a bag of cow ear cookies. She rudely almost yelled, "They are out of stock!" When I walked out, a couple walked in and came out a minute later with a bag of the cookies. The cookies are not worth the poor customer service. I will never go back again, and I definitely do not recommend this bakery. As for the fortune cookies, the factory on Ross Alley makes them fresh.
author: Kelli T.

description: If anything it was an experience to buy the much coveted 2 bags of cow ear snacks. The prior yelp reviews all hit it on the nail regarding the rudeness of the boss lady. We stopped by at 9am and a worker came out to tell the many outside that opening hour was 1pm. We came back at 1 to stand behind a large family group and had to wait another 40 mins before the boss came to open the store.  Her first words while unlocking the door to get in was we don't sell to children, directing it toward the two elementary aged kids in line. And true to her words she would not sell any of her precious snacks to them, not caring if the kids knew what to order and had cash in hand.  Perhaps the thrill of being able to grab a couple bags of these snacks makes it more alluring, driving the crowds to continue to patronize this store.
author: Susan L.

description: Rude! The old lady cashier have no manners and hates her business and job. Great cookies but horrible person.
author: Becky H.

description: Owner had TOTAL attitude when I simply asked if I can exchange a different bag. He said there's no picking. I asked what do you mean there's no picking? You've got boxes there. Unnecessary attitude for no reason. I even spoke in Chinese because I was trying to be polite and respectful, what a total douchebag. I don't care how good your cow ears are, I am not coming back. If it weren't for buying it on the request of others, I would have just walked out of there. Pls make sure they're not over charging and ripping you off as well. I saw prices at $4.50 and he now charged $5.
author: Sandra P.

description: I live in New York and was visiting California. My mom asked me to bring back some cow ear cookies for her. We emailed the owner for 20 packs and was suppose to pick It up at 2. We were 45 minutes early and thought we could've picked it up earlier. But the owner of this bakery was so rude and said "you said 2. You come back at two. Your email said at two do you want to see the email". His tone was disgusting. Although their cow ear cookies are good, it's not worth the horrid attitude we got.
author: Michelle Y.

description: i wish there's a zero star!! cow ears isnt as good as it seems! the owner has a shitty attitude and doesnt give a fuck if you buy the cow ears or not!! poor customer service!!! this business should close down!!! not worth the wait!!!
author: Cynthy C.

description:
Very rude service! Curses at customers. Don't know how they stay in business.

My mom and aunt tried to buy the fortune cookies from them. The owner did not want to sell to them because she said there is a two bag per person limit. But they had two people. She took the money and didn't want to give the fortune cookies bags.

Shame that because they are the only people to make the fortune cookies that they treat their customers so poorly.

Not coming back!
author: Dennis N.

description: Very rude old lady behind the counter! I came in and asked if they have the cow ears (i didnt know what it called and i explained with body language), the guy said they sold out and that rude lady said "i dont know what you are saying". I tried to explained again and she gave me an attitude! what the heck is wrong with her? Never coming back!!
author: Janice N.

description: So I used to come in and buy cow ears cookies like maybe 3-4 bags at a time since I live so far away I barely come now.  Well this ridiculously rude biatch says I can only buy 2 bags at $5 each.  I said oh really that's too bad given I live so far away and she says "well, people just come here and buy these only, I limit it so everyone can get some and if people only buy this how do I make a profit?!"  Ummm look lady why the hell would I buy your old ass fortune cookies when I can go to Ross Alley and see and smell that they are making them fresh.  Just because you limit people to 2 bags per person isn't going to force people to buy your old ass cookies and pastries when there are obviously fresher and better looking ones at other bakeries within walking distance...dude I'm not stupid I can see your dry ass pastries and cookies aren't worth eating.  What kind of horrible logic do these people have?  If you know your cow ear cookies are so popular than make more of them and less of your other items and even if you charged 50-75 cents more per bag and don't limit people I'm sure you'll make more of a profit than sitting there in an empty store with old baked goods.  You're just screwing your own business over frankly, with your rude behavior people just won't come back and eventually your store will have to shut down especially if some unsuspecting person purchases one of your old ass pastries and gets food poisoning.  I'll just take my money else where!
author: V J.

description: I just wanted to buy 2 bags of cow ears. I was greeted by a extremely rude woman and possibly her husband. I gave them a $100 bill and she rudely said she had no change. I came back maybe 3 min later and I gave her a $20 bill and she screams at me that they have no more, when I clearly see them right in front of me. Just lost a customer lady.
author: Justin L.

description: Seriously this is the worst place ever. The old lady that sits by the register has no manner what so ever  f*** the cow ears is not that good
author: ALICE T.

description: I've been shopping here for several decades.  When my mother was alive and living in LA, I used to pick up bags of fortune cookie rejects and take them down to her.  It was her favorite.  I have been buying the reject bags (malformed fortune cookies) for several decades.  They are fresh tasting and very very economical.
author: Carol F.

description: It's been here since 1950, a classic hole in the wall with authentic Chinese goodies and yumminess! Freshly made fortune cookies, flat fortune cookies of multiple sizes, sesame cookies, moon cakes, cow ear cookies, almond macarons! There are many more things but these are some of my faves. Definitely worth heading down to Chinatown for!
author: Amanda C.

description: Love this place!  Bought a variety of flavored fortune cookies for my kids.  And a bag of broken cookies cause they taste the same.
author: Car Y.

description: stuffs are good. the service, terrible cant even describe it. the cashier never gives u the look. i was try to ask a question. i didnt even ask. she replied,"one o'clock." and i tried again. didnt the chance to finish it. she answered, "i said one o'clock." if i didn't promise my friend. i will never ever buy. for the fact, today is my only and last time walk in. i was there to purchase not to get bullied. the store will be close becuase of her. the products never manage the service.  dont go, never come near that store. that is my best advice for all of u
author: Frank M.

description: I went in with the intention to buy some cookies but I was greeted by a rude lady. I immediately turned around and exited the store. She lost a would be customer due to an uninviting attitude. Next time think twice lady. Remember your customers are the reason for you daily bread and butter. I am all about customer service. If you can't be kind then I'll take my money elsewhere PERIOD!
author: Jafi S.

description:
I came all the way from L.A. and stopped to get some packages of their famous "cow ear" chips  to bring home for the family. When I walked up to the counter, the lady asked for my order, and I politely asked if they had any cow ears. Her face quickly turned sour and said that we had to wait until later if I wanted any. Disappointed, I was ready to walk out; however, the main baker in the back piped up,

                                                   "How many bags do you want?"

                                                           "Five, please," I replied.

        He turned back to packaging the baked goods of the day. Politely, I asked how long the wait for the cow ears were but the baker looked up in a fit of anger and screamed,

                              "Can't you see that I'm getting them ready right now?!" 

      I was completely taken aback by the severity of the statement, but I tried not to let it get to me. The hot weather and cramped work conditions would make any sane man snap. 

     The lady behind the counter packaged up the goods and mumbled, 

                                                     "Do you want a bag?"

    The roar of the machinery muffled the question. I asked,

                                              "Excuse me? What was that?"

    She sighed, voice heavily laced with the temperament of a DMV worker, and her eyes rolling,

                            "DO you want a bag? . . . DO YOU WANT A BAG?" 

        Shocked at the harsh reply, I declined with a smile and started to pack my cookies into my reusable bag, thinking that it'd be best if I tried to leave the premise with haste.

        As I was packing, the baker, with a rage that echoed the rampant pounding of the machines in the back, came to the front. He ripped a receipt from the counter and barked at the lady about information about the order. She tried to sneer back at him but soon faltered to his bullying. Scared of their exchange, I didn't even put the last bag of cow ears into my bag before I dashed out, vowing to never return. 

TLDR: Shop owners were dicks.
author: Tony C.

description: Very poor customer service. I came in the morning regarding cow ear cookies n they said they didn't have any at the moment. Come back at 2 and we'll have some. It's currently 1:44PM n I called them making sure they'll have some in stock before I go pick up some bags. Lady on the phone screamed i'm not taking phone orders! They're by ticket number only even when I went in the morning inquiring about it. Hung up on me and I called three additional times n she still hung up. Called once more and the guy picked up and told me they're low on stock it's by ticket number only. N I said back to him well she coulda just told me that instead of hanging up the phone multiple times. He hung up after I said that also LOL.
author: Emily L.

description: So rude. Would not ever come back. If I could give a negative star I would. There were two men behind the counter, an older man and a college looking guy. We came in asking for cow ear cookies, a recommendation from back home(NYC). We we were flying out the next day. They told us that they were sold out but the younger man was packing fresh cow ear cookies into bags for other customers. The older man kept telling us to leave and telling us that they had nothing for us. I even offered to pay more per bag. They said no. I have never encounter such bad customer service before. Don't come here unless you like to be scolded for wanting to give business money.
author: Katy L.

description: Worst customer service I've ever experienced. She was the rudest b**** I have ever had to deal with. Stay away! Or I guess if you want the cow ear cookies, be just as rude back. But honestly, I don't think they're worth the terrible experience. We even told her she didn't have to be so rude, and she didn't care, did not dial it back. Stay away
author: Tina W.

description: This is a hole in the wall like place. However they have a bunch if cool baked goods. Flat coin fortune cookies, cow's ear cookies and a few other varieties which i dont even know the names to. Friendly folks and tasty treats. If in Chinatown, hit up this hole and you might see some fortune cookie production
author: Kim N.

description:
Nothing better than a fresh fortune cookie! Ok maybe two are better! 

It's a tiny hole in the wall stacked with fresh colorful fortune cookies, you can buy one, a bag of 4 or by the pound!
author: Tamara S.

description: Honestly, I would say that they have good cox ear cookies but the service there was TERRIBLE !!!!! My friends asked the owner there that she wanted to purchase 15 bags but he said that we have to pre order then walked away. We tried to ask him if he would sell us as many as he had in stock since we came from LA, it was not easy to go all the way to SF to get some cookies. But the guy there refused to sell us the cookies and gave us attitude. I have never seen a store owner would actually refused to sell his products as we will paying for it. Just because your store is famous or you make good cox ear cookies so you can treat customers like shit?
author: Jiayi C.

description: The owners here were extremely rude. I entered this bakery and was about to order. As most bakeries around this neighborhood, I assumed the owners spoke Chinese. For this reason, I spoke to the female owner in Chinese. However, I was rudely cut off by her. She proceeded to shout at me in English. I completely understand that it might have been wrong of me to assume that she spoke Chinese, but for her to yell at me in English, that is something I do not understand. Regardless, I came back within a few days as my family enjoys their Cow Ears. However, this time I came to a disagreement with the male owner. I was on line and about to order four packages. When I kindly asked the owner, he yelled at me saying "what would the people behind you think if you order so many packages at once?" Hearing this, I lined up again, letting others place their orders first. When it was my turn once again,  the male owner proceeded to scold me, asking why I lined up a second time. I tried explaining my situation to him saying how I really wanted to order two more. He simply threw the packages in front of me and told me to pay in an extremely impatient voice. While the Cow Ears here are good, I am 100% against the manners of the owners.
author: Barbara Z.

description: Would never come back to be treated like a p.o.s. WHY?! Came to this place because of all the hype about cow ear chips all the way from L.A. at 11:55. Owner told us come back at 12:00 or make a line outside when they have the bag of chips all lined up.  She wouldn't sell it to us until 12:00 pm. WTF?! 12:00 came and we only had a $100 with us and she said no change. WTF again... Good thing there's a chase next door and we were able.to get 3 bags each.  Her rude tone and bad service will not make me return.
author: Ying Ho C.

description:
I knew this placed existed and would check em bc theyre nxt to walgreen's. Instead of buyin my usual I came here bc when golden gate bakery closes for vacation, theyre gone 3-4 weeks. Mee mee bakery has satisified my needs for cow ear snacks, chewey pork cookies, and loh poh beng (winter melon cakes, old wife's cake). The WM cakes are thick and heavy. Good flavor and reasonably priced at $2. The 2nd item I purchased was the pork chewy cookies. Theyre fattening and delicious though. Probably has lard,  but what has lard that doesnt taste good? Theyre the rite thickness so u dont pull any cavity fillings out.
They make the best cow ear snack crackers!! Pricey at $4 a bag, makes u wanna stretch em ovr a week. (I lapsed and finished a bag in an hour). I'm weak. Forgive me.

i've edited the review. i returned the following day (yup forgot to check-in AGAIN). my co-worker requested some loh poh beng. $2 each but they fit jus nicely in a small square plastic container that they packed em in. the owner scotch taped it so it wouldnt pop open (and deterred me from jacking one).
i also upped MMB from 4 stars to 5 STARS
so u can tell, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS BAKERY. it has some old school yummy items (read as, stuff still made of lard, which makes the pastry flakey and delicious)
author: Keikaikaoakua P.

description: The Man was so rude to me, i think he is owner. I said buy 5 cow ears. He said one person per   1 limited. how come ? ? ? he doesn't want to run his business. But another day my friend's dad brought 5.
author: Lap C.

description: I agrees with all other reviewer.... I would have give it zero star if I can. I have come to Mee Mee for many years now (I think more than 10 years now). In the past, they always have the Cow Eye snackers available and you just need to go there without have to place an order. Last time I went there back in November 2016, a RUDE lady at the register told me that I have to order them if I want to purchase a lot. Therefore, I've went to their website and it mention please email your order to meemeebakerysf@gmail.com to order any of their products since they no longer accepting online order and payment via PayPal. So that is what I have done. I sent them an email. Since I haven't heard back from them. I've decided to call and a very RUDE lady (I think it might be the same one) answer the phone. She told me that I have to come in and place the order today and come back to pick it up on Thursday. Since I don't live in SF, I told her if I can just tell her over the phone what I want to order now and come on Thursday to pick it up. She say "no" and hang up the phone on me. If she is not the owner, I think the owner should fire her!!! This business customer service has been going down hill!!!!!
author: Samantha T.

description: Rudest customer service ever. Do not go there. The register lady will yell at you and disrespect you for trying to buy more than two bags of cow cookies. Go somewhere else!
author: James C.

description: This is the place for sesame cookies!! Almond cookies are great too. They don't fake it by adding excess almond extract.
author: Alex O.

description:
Real old world charm in a new world age. 

The register still has numbers that spin. 

Got the tofu cookies when I was hungry and they were delicious - sweet but not overly so, and hearty enough to be filling. 

Everything seemed fresh and crisp, what a happy find.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Best place in Chinatown to buy fortune cookies according to my better half... 

I'll have to say that they are very crisp and light when they are fresh. By the time you have one in your favorite Chinese restaurant, they are probably stale... 

I was a busboy in Chinatown a long time ago and I remember fortune cookies by the box load... 

I'm not sure but I think you can also get the "racy" versions of fortune cookies here too (e.g. Foo Ling Yu says: blah blah blah), I just don't remember if it is this one...
author: Lawrence L.

description: $2.5 a big bag of rejected fortune cookies, the best bargain you can find in Chinatown!
author: Meiyi C.

description:
Walking along Stockton Street, we come across the sweet smell of freshly baked fortune cookies so we peek in and immediately the wifey FINALLY finds the place she has been telling me for years about her elemantary school field trip she had long ago to a fortune cookie factory.

The machine was cranking away hundreds of fortune cookies and the smell was so addicting I had to get some. they have other sweets and treats as well, but I just wanted fortune cookies, so I grabbed a big bag of multi-colored ones which I thought were the same flavor, but came out to be assorted flavors as well which was cool!...ALOHA!!!
author: Nelson Q.

description:
To the person asking below if "we really care that they place has rats": Yes, I do care.

My melon cake went right into the garbage, and I'll never be returning. Screw it, I'll never be returning to Chinatown to eat ever again; there is better Chinese food downtown or in the marina, where it hasn't been sitting under heat  (more like warm) lamps all day since 6:30AM.

This place has vermin!
author: Stevie D.

description: I never like to make review but this time I can't stand it. They have a very very very bad customer service!!!
author: S C.

description:
Everyone raves about the fortune cookies, but I prefer the cookies at Golden Gate Fortune Cookies.  What's interesting about this place is that they sell flavor fortune cookies and Adult fortunes.  Some of the flavors are a little too light in taste that you have to look at the color of the cookie to figure out the flavor.  As for the Adult fortunes, they are pretty crude/vile, think f-word a lot and that's what the fortune will read.

I like this place for their Almond Macrons.  They are amazing in flavor with a strong Almond extract taste.  Keep in mind that the texture is not what you normally would expect from a  Macron.  It looks like it would be crispy, but it's almost bordering soft.

Also, keep in mind, they DO NOT like it if you take photos of their machines/shop.  You can go and look at how they make it, but DO NOT take photos.
author: Alissa Y.

description:
Giant fortune cookies sold here!!! Mmm. Only $10.50 too. I went to the Golden Gate Fortune Cookie factory and they were selling it for like $16.50. Boo.

They have colored fortune cookies too. I don't think they're different flavors. They tasted all the same to me. They have kinda a sesame aftertaste. 

They had some cool looking zodiac animal cookies but they don't taste good. At all. But cute.
author: Karen Y.

description:
Stopped by here before finding the better-known (but kind of hidden) "other" fortune cookie store in Chinatown.  This place is an actual store so no watching workers folding the fortunes in the cookies.

The cookies themselves are a little thicker and heavier than I'd like them to be.  Maybe if I had some milk or something instead of eating them by themselves on the sidewalk.  

Taste-wise, the cookies are great.  Not-too-sweet but definitely a dessert treat.  And they had ginger flavored cookies that the Mrs. likes better than the regular variety.
author: Eric M.

description: A must go place when I'm in San Francisco. It locates in Chinatown, parking is not easy of course. I had to find a parking structure and walk a few blocks to this place. I always get a few bags of the cow ears, it's my favorite snack in my childhood. It brings up a lot happy memories too.
author: Emma Z.

description:
I needed a gift and MEE MEE came through with a unique and kind of awesome one. it's a huge fortune cookie, and you can have them put whatever you want in it, from a custom fortune to an engagement ring. Or wads of cash. Whatever you want. I hate giving boring gifts so this opens up some great opportunities and I'll go back again and again. Throughout the process I had access to them via email and phone, and the order was turned around in a matter of a few days.

I picked the gift up at the store and discovered an array of other fortune cookie options. you can see the machinery that they use to make them, which is kind of cool. And they have these other things called cow's ears. They're kind of like potato chips, but have a cool stripey pattern. Anyway, customers kept coming in and buying those, too. Mee Mee is known for them.
author: Mark N.

description:
This USE TO be a must go to place.  I always make it a point to buy some almond or chocolate macaroons when I'm in the city. So this time was no different, but I wish I went by gut instinct that they didn't look as good as they normally do. I bought a 1/2lb of macaroons.....I immediately opened the bag to eat some, and the chocolate one crumbled as I bit into it.  Normally they are soft and chewy with a crispy edge, as macaroons should be.  Then I tried one the almond ones.  Not as bad, but definitely could tell they weren't far behind the chocolate ones in terms of freshness.  It was too late to stop my friend from buying his share from one of the twin salesgirls.  
As my friends and I stood outside comparing notes,...I was so disappointed, that I thought I didn't have anything to lose by telling them that they weren't fresh.  The response I got was, "we bake them fresh, and then we freeze them.  Let them sit out for a bit, and they'll get chewy again."
I told the girl that they weren't frozen and not even cold.  I'm very familiar on what the texture of a macaroon should be like.  She stood her ground and insisted they were fine.  My politeness deteriorated, and I finally told her that they were just about stale, and shouldn't be like that.
She then says, "what do you want me to do about it?"
I replied, "can you take them back?"  Her reply was "no."
Rather then argue, I told my other friend who about to buy something, not to bother....and we all left.  TERRIBLE customer service!! 
I've been going here for over 35 years, and have never had a bad experience here until now.  Didn't even get an apology....or offer an exchange.
They have lost a customer for life, which is sad because whenever I have company visiting from out of town, I've ALWAYS suggested them to stop by here for macaroons.  No more.....if I could negative stars, I would.
It's so sad to have to write this review.  Epic FAIL.
author: tj c.

description:
Mee Mee Bakery is a few doors away from stockton & broadway. It's a family runned bakery making fortune cookies, mooncakes, and chinese baked goods. the automated fortune cookie rolling machine can be seen in the back.

highlights
-"misfortunes":: bags of cookies sold at a discount  that weren't made right. the taste is the same.
-mooncakes when they are in season
-baked item, (looks like a chocolate cookie). made with pork fat and flour, forgot the name. sinfully delicious.
author: Victor G.

description: Came here to buy some gifts to bring back to my family in NY. Asked for an additional two bags of cow ear chips and got the illest attitude from the lady working there. A mother and son came in after me and left empty handed because of her rude statement to them. If service was better, this place would've gotten a higher rating.
author: Cindy Y.

description: Chinatown landmark, this bakery has been here well over 40 years. Not sure exactly how long, all I know is, my mom took me here as a toddler to buy fresh cookies. That was definitely over 4 decades ago. Fortune cookies, cow ears, moon cakes, wife's cookies are their specialty. You have to ask for the XXX fortune cookies. (These fortunes have sayings like " Go F@#k yourself", "Good for one free blowjob",ect...) Great for adult fun. They have it hidden in a bin behind the counter.
author: Paul L.

description:
The only place in San Francisco to get flavored fortune cookies- and believe me, I've done my research. 

Fortune cookies are made on site (though don't expect a factory tour like the shop in the alley), where you can get prepackaged or bring in your own fortunes and have them made up for you. 

Strawberry, chocolate, plain, or a mix of all three. Half pound or one pound bags, a one pound bag (~$8) contains about 50 cookies. Cookies last about a week before getting stale. Chocolate looks and tastes the best. The strawberry could use both a little more flavor and color. 

These work pretty well if you're looking for a cheap party favor. JoAnn Fabrics, Party City, or the like sells plastic treat bags that you can use to package them individually.
author: Joanne G.

description: Honestly, I don't make Yelp reviews at all, but I decided to make one because I felt like I had to. My family and I traveled from Los Angeles to San Francisco and we were craving some cow ear cookies. My mother said that they had the best cow ear cookies and that we should give it a try. We went in to the bakery hoping for a nice greeting, but got a rude, "What do you want?" I was shocked on how rude she was being. Like wtf man. When we asked for the cow ear cookies, she only gave us two bags. My aunt wanted one too, but they only had two bags. When we asked if they were making any more, the lady was all like, "We only have two bags. Either get the two or nothing." In my head, I was about to throw the two bags in her face, but instead, I said, "Okay, we'll take the two bags. But you don't have to be so rude about it." (The reason why we bought it was because we were craving it). While I was saying that, she was muttering something to herself. Like okay. And when we paid for it, I asked, "Do you guys have a bag?" Just saying, I didn't realize that San Francisco went bag less. LOOOOL Sorry for being a typical LA girl But she said, "We don't have bags. I hope you know that", but in a really snobby tone. No lady, I didn't know that. So I said, "We're from LA. We didn't know that." And guess what she said? She said, "Yeah right." We were out of the store by the time she said that. I was about to say something, but my mom told me to leave. DON'T EVER COME HERE! I REPEAT DON'T EVER COME HERE. Unless you want crappy service, and a rude ass lady, don't go. I would give it 0 stars if I can.
author: Jenny W.

description:
my mom will never leave norcal without first making a stop here. she always comes back with lotsa goodies! 

we now have a box of bags and bags of cookies. 

there's a bag of mixed fortune cookie coins (fortune cookies, but in a coin shaped), which is really yummy and bite-sized, easy to eat. i've been picking out the strawberry (pink) ones. my mom scolded me for doing that...she says it's selfish =( 

but the star of the goodies, are the cow ears. they're these, light, crispy, swirly cookie things that are a bit salty and sweet, with a delicate flavor i can't really explain. definitely recommend these!!
author: Lisa N.

description:
I always love stopping by this bakery.  They sell a variety of delicious Chinese treats.  My favorite being the small flat fortune cookie crisps that come in a variety of flavors.  I also love their chocolate macaroons, they are incredible.

The workers there are very friendly and always greet me with a big smile whenever I visit. 

After reading some reviews on those cow ear chips, I think I shall stop by and try some the next time I'm in the area.
author: Mark F.

description:
Love the smell of all the fresh baked goodies in here!

You can get all sorts of favored fortune cookies, almond macaroons, and almond cookies....shhhh....I LOVE the COW EAR CHIPS!

Crispy, light and sooooo tasty!  It look like a cow ear with swirls...but don't believe me...go try them yourself and you will fall in love with the chips.

Everytime we are in SF China town, we have to pickup a case of cow ear chips. This is the best spot to get them!

Highly Recommended.
author: Gorman E.

description:
They have giant fortune cookies!!!

This place was a great find one day we were wandering aimlessly around Chinatown. Mee Mee has different flavors (chocolate, strawberry, coffee, maybe green tea I forget) of fortune cookies and they come in all different shapes and sizes. My favorite are the flat coin shaped fortune cookies. I'm convinced that fortune cookies taste much better flat than shaped into a fortune, but that's just me. I also had the almond macaroon, which was sweet and delicious! They also do custom orders, which could definitely be a fun idea. Next house warming, I'm definitely bringing a bag of these.
author: Brian L.

description:
Best place for fortune cookes that are big, small, colored, flat shaped like a coin, cow ear cookies (they are brown and cream colored), and the Almond Bon bon and the Chocolate Bon bon. These are all my favorites from this bakery.  

This is such a great little place and the fortune cookies make great souvenirs.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Fun little shop!

I had to try an almond macaroon (75 cents each). It was really good. Almost reminded me a little bit of gourmet cotton candy (don't ask).

Friend got a bunch of sesame cookies - they were not as sweet as I'd expect for a cookie, but they were definitely real good.

What most impressed me was the proprietor took lots of time to explain to my friend what many of the offerings were, and what he could expect. Real cool.
author: Conrad B.

description: This is a low key Chinese bakery with it's old school charm located in Russian Hill/Chinatown area of SF. Operates mostly as kitchen that ships their famous fortune cookies to different restaurants and stores, but also sells their cookies to the public in the front of the store. I came here to get their famous "Cow Ears" cookies for the family after dim sum-ing nearby (FYI, they're not actually cow ears or any other cow parts...they're named Cow Ears for the shape of the cookies). We have been getting these cookies as gifts ever since we were kids from our SF relatives, and it's always so nostalgic to get my hands on one of them - and did I mention they're delicious too?
author: Anya S.

description:
Mee Mee Bakery is hard to miss...just follow the scent of sweet cookies when you reach the Chinatown/North Beach border and you will find it. It's a small little shop with bags of fortune cookies in different shapes and flavors piled along the window (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zgBfOxGRJ4ICSUTrb_qUfg?select=q4q2p5lQT-TDRPdIjVvuKg).

Their fortune cookies were perfectly crunchy and sweet which made them addicting to eat! My friends and I bought a mixed bag with flavors of regular, chocolate, strawberry, and a blue one that I couldn't figure out. They were fun to snack on and reading the lame, generic fortunes was entertaining. I think I still prefer the original flavor but the crunchiness was the best part! They also sold giant fortune cookies for $10.50 each which was pretty cool (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zgBfOxGRJ4ICSUTrb_qUfg?select=qfbpAXY5PVRF2u_K9T_Zww). 

Their bags of cookies ranged from $3-$7 depending on the flavor and amount but they can last you a while. Cash only. I can't wait to come back!
author: Karen Y.

description: Ask for prices before your purchase. Cow ear snacks are $4 for 8oz. per online.  Which was what I paid in February. Today it was $4.50!
author: T L.

description:
Love passing by, but couldn't resist it's alluring baked goods smell that I had to go in and buy something that tasted equally as delectable in aroma.

Of course I had to get a bag of "cow ear" cookie/snack. Don't worry no animals were harmed in the making of these crunchy little treats! I also couldn't help getting a small bag of egg cookies (they taste like the aroma of the bakery) for the trip home! 

I hope this place never goes out of business. Where else would I get my bakery fix?
author: Amy C.

description: A nice place to stop by for a coffee and pastry. The creme is heavy but not all of the stuff is completely filled, just filled on the ends.
author: M C.

description: A bag of fortune cookies for $4.75? Hells to the yeah.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
All the other reviewers have already noted (correctly) that their fortune cookies, cow ear cookies and almond cookies are amazing at this small, family-run joint. And it really does smell delicious here.

But...they missed out on the bestest part of this bakery.

ALMOND MACAROONS. 
http://meemeebakery.com/cookies.html
they're extra-super sweet, but very "hoing" (Cantonese) - aka, beautiful tasting. Try these. You won't regret it. I promise. And take small bites.

Other notable snacks:
Sesame cookies
Icebox cookies

I'd recommend ordering the macaroons in bulk for bridal showers, baby showers, parties, etc and putting them in cute little boxes/packets to give out as favors.
author: Flora T.

description: Macaroons are to die for, fresh fortune cookies, AND the first person to admit they spoke English AND he knew what the name of the candy Ii have been searching for since childhood - sugared melon. We WILL be back.
author: Anne S.

description:
Mee Mee Bakery might have a large variety of pastries and all sizes of fortune cookie imaginable, but I come to Mee Mee for their reject bags of fortune cookies.  

Sure, some of these reject cookies may be flat or have five stacked fortunes in the middle, but they are still impossibly crispy and understandably addictive.  Some of the bags of failures might even include a variety of flavors.  The best part is that these reject bags are only $2!
author: Andrew M.

description:
Got here about half hour before their closing time and they were completely sold out of the cow ear cookies ;( They're my husband's absolute FAVORITE treats in the world. So bummed especially since we're not from the area and were just passing through.

Bought a few almond macaroons instead and they were DELICIOUS! They were super soft yet slightly chewy in the middle. LOVED the almond flavor! Now they're one of my favorite treats! 

The lady at the cashier was friendly and apologetic and offered to set aside some of the cow ear cookies for me if I came back the next day but unfortunately, we weren't going back that way. Until next time.....
author: Allison Q.

description:
Mee Mee. No No.

If you have to venture onto the overly congested block of Stockton south of Broadway, you may be tempted like I was to duck into this little bakery. It's probably a bad sign when you see the entire staff on stools slurping their bowls of hot-and-sour soup. Gee, who's minding the counter?

We got a little baggie of some quite unexceptional coconut macaroons. I don't think macaroons are supposed to be crunchy, but I ate them anyway. And couldn't they afford an entire maraschino cherry on each one rather than the unrecognizable sliver they provided? Ah well, I guess the next time I'll go to Golden Gate Bakery and wait in that endless line for my baked goodies.
author: Ed U.

description:
So my tour of the Chinatown is coming to an end, and the visit is not complete without at least seeing inside Mee Mee Bakery, that's what I was told by my friend here. "Why? We just walked past like three bakery on the way here." "Come on," she protested, " you will see once you get inside."

Wait. Is that...? No way! "See I told you!" she scoffed. So what did I see in here? GIANT FORTUNE COOKIES! and I do mean giant. They must bring some giant good luck! You can get their fortune cookies, giant or mere regular size, in the original (vanilla) flavor or chocolate flavor.

Mee Mee also have other cookies variety; Almond macaroons are another one of my favorite snack, and so were "cow ear" snacks, which were baked with coloring and shape that resemble a cow's ear. Other noticeable items are the coin cookies, chocolate bon-bon, and butter cookies.

I know I shouldn't, but I really can't help myself. I ended up walking away with two bags full of snacks. Shame on me.
author: Kuanyu C.

description: I came here recently to get a giant fortune cookie as a gift but there was only one left and the color of the bow wasn't the one I wanted. The owner was nice enough to change out the bow and ribbon for me after the other customers left. As I was waiting I also picked out a bag of cow ears which were nice and crispy. The service here was great but I felt like the place could be cleaned up a bit.
author: Ada W.

description:
Great mom and pop shop, a variety of flavors of fortune cookies.... Love the variety flavor of little coins chips. I love the fortune cookies and all, but mee mee bakery is a bit pricey. 1lb of the variety of coins $7. Cookie are good, but not a all the time treat.


Tips:
Cash only.
Surrounded with a lot of chinese grocery stores.
 Won't find parking in the area.
author: Paulie L.

description:
Review based purely on the fragrance of the freshly baked colorful fortune cookies

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Lisa:       hmm, smells good
Mom:      better stop before you get fat from just the smell!
Lisa:       fml.
author: Lisa W.

description: Mee Mee Bakery is one of the shops to visit for fortune cookies. I tried their original flavored fortune cookies which tasted really good. The freshness is what makes every product delicious which ultimately gets more customers to come and get fortune cookies. Overall, good experience here. These fortune cookies are perfect for a quick snack or confection.
author: Bennett W.

description:
Ordered 150 custom fortune cookies for a fundraiser.  They were so helpful, got them done in 2 days and the process was so easy.  Quick phone call,  Email and paypal and DONE!  Based on the  Yelp reviews, I asked my husband to pick up a bag of cow ears and some macaroons-- YUM!    Not sure why the cow ears are addictive, but they are!  The macaroons as good as french ones for way more money elsewhere.  

I will be back.
author: M R G.

description: It seems like a dingy place, but their baked goods are amazing.  I know everyone loves the fortune cookies here, but I LOVE the almond cookies!  I've been to SF twice and both times we bought a few bags to bring back for ourselves and family.  Hopefully I'll get some friends in SF to send me a bag once in a while to fulfill my almond cookie fix.  :)
author: Jade L.

description:
DON"T COME HERE UNLESS YOU HAVE CASH!!

Ok, I made the mistake of visiting this fortune cookie bakery with only a few bucks in my wallet.  I picked up some coin shaped cookies, chocolate fortune cookies, and almond cookies.  I was hoping to use my credit card to buy all of them.  

I was really disappointed that this bakery does not accept Credit cards.  I ended up just buying 2 bags of fortune cookie..lol.

This bakery definitely makes good fortune cookies.  

I thought since they had their own website, they would accept Credit Cards.  The website even states that they accept credit cards, but I guess that is only for online orders.
author: Rita V.

description: Mee Mee Bakery has been my go to place for fortune cookies. They come in different colors, shapes, size, etc... You can taste the freshness in each bite!
author: M W.

description:
I am addicted to their cookies....

Came here with my aunt, mom, and sister... and we bought like $40+ worth of cookies.... we got the fortune cookies, sesame cookies, almond cookies, egg cookies, and some other cookies.

My favorite is the almond cookies. The texture is amazing and has a lot of flavor. We bought the big bag and split it three ways. I still have mine and its been almost two weeks and it is still really fresh, just like when I first got them. 

I also got myself a bag of fortune cookies. soooo yummy.
author: Alicia W.

description: You can't pass by this place without being grabbed by the aroma of their fresh baked cookies.. Everyone who walks past this small shop notices the delicious smell right away! I always go for their thin crispy almond cookies (~$3-4 per box), the mini almond cookies (~$3-4/half lb., ~$4-5 per lb.), and the flat fortune cookies that are *gasp* fortuneless! This is a cool place to check out if you're a tourist or a local.. You get to watch their old-fashioned machine in the back crank out these timeless Chinese classics.. They also sell almond macaroons, moon cakes (seasonal item), gigantic fortune cookies, and various other bakery items.. Even their cash register is old fashioned and fun to look at! It has raised buttons like an old-fashioned typewriter and the numbers displayed on the front (your total due) are like a counting clicker where you can see the numbers rotate.. This shop is very small and cramped but a lot of history lies within those walls.. All of my friends that I've taken to this bakery are a big fan and return frequently.. It is definitely a hidden gem!
author: Alysia W.

description: Chocolate fortune cookies are fresh and delicious (3 stars for the cookies). And yes, the place smells great.  But the service leaves a lot to be desired.  I stood for nearly 5 minutes trying to get the attention of the one worker (all the way in the back) just so I could pay for my 1 measly bag of cookies (lg bag $7).
author: Kelly K.

description: Awesome fortune cookies that are made fresh daily (I think), at great prices! $5 gets you a large bag of fortune cookies :)
author: Michelle L.

description: This little bakery located in Chinatown has a great variety of Chinese goodies at decent prices. I got some mysterious melon pastry that I've never tried before and was pleasantly surprised with how fresh and flakey it was. I also got a small bag of mixed flavor fortune cookies. I never even knew you could get fortune cookies with different colors/flavors until I came to Mee Mee.
