I don't know enough about Chinese desserts to compare to anyone elses but there was nothing disappointing about the prices, service, or food I got here.
author: Matt E.

description:
MeeMee bakery is a nice little shop with cookies and all types of baked goods plastered across the wall and behind glass. Nothing to look at, but i doubt you come here for the looks of the place. You come for the awesome cookies. 

The flavored fortune cookies are pretty good and that's pretty much all I've eaten there. The strawberry fortune cookies have a very subtle taste. Not too strong but bordering on underwhelming. The chocolate fortune cookies are great though. Nice chocolatey taste. I gotta admit, I still favor the plain fortune cookies. Maybe next time I'll try some
other baked goods but until then it's a solid three stars in my book.
author: Domingo D.

description:
Grocery shopping is a big ordeal for me. I never know what I want until I see it. 

Grocery shopping in Chinatown is a bigger ordeal. There are no wide aisles and shopping carts and people politely saying "Excuse me" as they pass by you. No. Here, I was being tutored in picking out just the right thing and being elbowed by little old Chinese ladies and given tons of single-use plastic bags that I kept denying, having whipped out my handy dandy chicobags. 

On my way to such a tiny market for something, I passed by Mee Mee Bakery. The smell of fresh fortune cookies (my downfall) lured me in. 

This tiny bakery makes tons of delicious fortune cookies and other tasty Chinese pastries that you see in a few Asian supermarkets. 

Without hesitation, I reached for the rejected fortune cookies. I don't want any fortunes! Just the cookie! If you don't really care about the shape (like me!), this is a great bag of cookies to pick up.

I was in and out of the bakery within 5 minutes. And no elbowing needed.  For less than $2, this is good cheap eats!

Now back to learning how to elbow people in tiny markets while meticulously inspecting the each product. Next time, I need to wear my fightin' shoes.
author: Julia W.

description:
You know how sometimes you go get your nails done and sometimes they look at you and talk in a different language and they give you this look? and sometimes you wonder if they might just be talking about you? Yeah- i hate that feeling too. LOL. But she didnt do that. I asked for a tour of the fortune cookie place and they were so nice about it. 

I LOOOOVVVEEE fortune cookies. I can eat about 10 in one sitting. And they have really crunchy cookies here that are made fresh. 

They also have these thin crispy almond cookies that are amazing!
author: Aidan V.

description:
Gee this tight little space churns out a lot of fortune cookies!  The nice lady behind the counter gave the kids and me a little tour of where and how they make the cookies.  We walked out with a big bag of cookie materials that didn't cut it to become full fledged fortune cookies. My 6-year-old thought the process was interesting and enjoyed watching a cookie develop from the blob of dough dropped into the track taking it down through the mechanisms and taking shape into a cookie. 

Go for a visit:
http://www.meemeebakery.com/aboutus.html
author: Kristine D.

description: good sesame cookies .my daughter and husband loves their almond cookies . their macaroons are good also but it is sweet ! also their smackles are good /cow ears no they are not real cow ears ......I don't think ?
author: Nellie J.

description:
OK. This review is not based on the quality of the fortune cookie, but rather on the service. So 3 weeks ago I was there with some friends and the chinese lady was so rude to us when we asked to take some photos. I understand that you might not like it when people take photos of how you make cookies, but gosh, you don't have to be so rude about it. Her attitude was not good. I'm not bringing my out of town guests here no more. 

The first time (years ago) I was there we had to beg for a cookie sample. We just wanted to taste it to see if we wanted to buy a whole bag. The lady behind the counter was very reluctant and broke off small pieces of a cookie for us to try. Why not just give one cookie away? I mean how much is it going to cost? Like 3 cents? Once again, not customer oriented.

This place should welcome people into their stores and offer free samples. They would make much more money that way. I'm very disappointed. Once again, the quality of their cookies are fine. I'm speaking of their customer service.

I think it's a tad bit expensive. $4 something for a small bag, but that's just my opinion. Tourists would be happy to pay that price.
author: Miguel T.

description: So we went here today because we were told that they make great fortune cookies and that you can customize your messages. However, when we got there they said it was too late. By the way, it was only like 4:00 PM However, the lady said she could ship them to us so maybe we will call in an order. Who knows. It was kind of cool to see how they do it and it is something you should check out the next time you are in the area.
author: David R.

description: Everything is great, but just a little disappointed about the parking validation.  The employee didn't stamp my parking ticket with the correct parking validation stamp. So I had to pay the full amount.  But even that wasn't too bad@ $8.00 on the weekends for the entire day. I will still recommend thIs bakery. I am still enjoying the bag of fortune cookie seconds that I purchased and the elephant ears,   a hidden secret.  Buy lots you won't be disappointed.
author: Michael T.

description: Tasty! I really enjoyed the chocolate walnut(?) bonbons. They make chocolate fortune cookies, too! We bought a bag to take home. Unassuming location, quite a variety of Zodiac cookies as well. Yum.
author: Penelope B.

description: With colorful fortune cookies everywhere and piled up high, it is difficult to ignore this place for any onlookers. I finally had to drop in to get a bag of premium fortune cookies last night and it was fresh, crispy, and very tasty. My bag came with small flat cookies that were made of strawberry, chocolate, and vanilla flavors and I must say that I like chocolate and vanilla the best. The strawberry had a sesame aftertaste that I didn't agree with but otherwise it was well worth the price ($3.95). Comparing to other places, their cookies were less sugary but certainly more thin and crisp. It was fascinating to see how they make everything on site with heavy machinery in the back, and to learn that they also sell moon cakes, breads, macaroons, and other types of cookies. I will definitely be back for more.
author: Daniel L.

description:
The authentic (if there is such a thing) fortune cookie factory, with perfectly flavored cookies, fresh out of the ovens.  You can get large bags, adult messages (X-rated), or the "rejects" -- the ones that didn't get folded properly. These are sold at a discount and are fun to munch on.  But my favorites are the silver-dollar sized cookies -- they are bite sized, the same batter as fortune cookies, but with a smoothly rounded scalloped edge.  Truly scrumptious!  

They will also make custom message cookies for you - -just ask the owner, who is great.  Try to give about a week for processing, although once I had an emergency and they did some for me while I waited ( I brought my own fortunes, which makes it harder for them -- they prefer to do the fortunes themselves).  We used the cookies as favors at my wedding, and I've used them in the past for business events.  Everyone loves them.  

They also make great sesame cookies and almond cookies.  The little ones they serve at the Japanese Tea Garden.  These are so delightful, and luckily, they haven't changed the recipe in years.  

Parking is fierce on this stretch of Stockton -- it's best to go with a friend who will circle the block while you run in.  

If you are there at the right part of the day, you can watch them making fortune cookies -- they invented the machine, and little ladies still fold and stuff them with fortunes -- it's fascinating.
author: Bevy M.

description: Anytime I'm in San Francisco, I have to pick up fortune cookies and cow ear cookies from this place.  Definitely good stuff!
author: John L.

description:
Somebody always makes a stop here for their fortune cookies before the annual association dinner we attend at Gold Mountain; this time it was K and me.

When we walked it, we were the only ones.  The guy running the shop was in the back making cookies (or rather, keeping an eye on the machine making cookies) and invited us back there to check things out.  Pretty cool stuff!  He was making strawberry cookies and offered us a try.  It was my first time trying the strawberry and was surprised that I really enjoyed it!

Eventually, we made our way back to the front of the bakery and the place actually started to fill up with customers...  K and I got our bag(s) of plain (what flavor is that?  Vanilla?) mini coin cookies and were happy as clams!  We'll be back next year, for sure!
author: Christine T.

description:
Just walking in and smelling the fortune cookies baking is a treat in itself. Mee Mee Bakery has a great selection of not only fortune cookies, but also flattened fortune cookies, coin cookies and other Chinese treats. 

The price is right if you need a large quantity of cookies and you know it's fresh since they bake everything on-site.
author: Lee H.

description: YUM!  i'm a huge fan of their cow ear snackers since i was a child and as an adult, i love the fact i can come by and buy some!   crunchy, sweet, and savory all in one bite!
author: Anita C.

description: All I have to say is that you need to try their cow ears.. They are crispy, light and just so good. It's like a chip but not as salty .. Call in advance because they are normally sold out of them. Their fortune cookies were good too.. Just the right thickness and sweetness..
author: June C.

description: I came across this small, dark fortune cookie bakery by accident. Serendipity!! The place has piles and bags of fortune cookie type of products and these cow ear snackers. I wish the lady who was there at the cashier made some recommendations to me cuz I wish I had gotten more! I got a bag of flat/round cookies seasoned with black seseames and a bag of cow ear cookies. They were both good but the cow ear cookies were AMAZING! I want to order more from their website ......but it's 1 box min. now...can someone order it with me? :-)
author: yinmeng y.

description: i just brought two bon bon for a 1.00.  But they make custom fortune cookies and ship anywhere.  They make for any occassion and print your messages in the cookies they got web site just google the bakery name it the same with the .com.
author: John F.

description: I bought a fortune cookie here. Though I was advised not to order a warm one, I overruled the boss lady, and loved it. Still upset about my decision, the boss lady insulted me/called me cheap for not buying one for my friend. I never enjoyed an insult so much. Big lotus cake selection.
author: Andrew K.

description: Greatest little place for fortune cookies, I love the variety they have! Strawberry, Vanilla, Chocolate, Sesame & even Coffee fortune cookies. Super cheap prices $3.20 - $4.90 a bag.  They also carry the large decorative fortune cookies. Everything tastes very fresh! While the store isn't fancy, the service is efficient and the prices and product is yummy!
author: Marissa P.

description: They've got fortune cookie coins!  You can see them being made too.  It's a pretty cool machine they have there.  It tastes good because it's so fresh.  I love that you can see and smell it all!
author: Linda P.

description: Large bag of fortune cookies or salty chinese cracker only $2.
author: Cathaleya C.

description:
This place brings back childhood memories each time I walk by and take a whiff of the sweet smell of all things fortune cookies. Within moments, I am 5 again sipping on malt Vitasoy, barely able to see over the counters, and tugging on dad to reach for a bag of "B" grade fortune cookies, which are visually imperfect, but taste just the same (and cheaper).

I have since grown up and taken a new liking to their flavored fortune cookies like chocolate and strawberry. Between the two, choco wins the taste test, packing a pretty robust chocolate taste.  Another favorite of mine are their Shangri-la Cow Ears cookies.  It's not really made from cow ears, but is shaped like one thinly sliced with cream and brown swirls.  Looking at it, one would think it would probably taste like vanilla and chocolate, but it actually has a sweet and salty taste that's quite addictive.  I finished a bag in one sitting, looked at my greasy fingers, and knew it was not going to fair well with my waistline line, and it was off to the gym I went :(  I have yet to try their non-fortune cookie items, but I will definitely fill you in when I do.

I would have given this place 4 stars for taste, selection, and cheap thrills, but I am resting with 3 for lack of customer service.  Plus, it's a headache going in there amongst all that clutter.
author: Nancy G.

description: This place sells huge fortune cookies that are individually packed, and the owner told us that some guys have even proposed using them (although one guy dropped his ring while they were making the fortune cookie batter, so be careful).  The cookies taste fresh, which makes sense as they're made on site.  Fortune cookies in different flavors, sizes, shapes are available - they also custom make fortune cookies with your own messages if you want.  Their card says "we ship anywhere", and they also do "rush orders."  If you want fortune cookies, this is the place!  They also have other pastries, sesame cookies and the like.
author: Lyn Y.

description: I was walking around and saw an interesting looking store that mainly sold cookies. When you walk in you feel like your in your grandparents era or something. The cash register is pretty old and in the back the machines are running cranking out the cookies. I was attracted to the fortune cookies. Wow, they have chocolate, multi-colored ones, and also strawberry! Who would've thought of the other flavors?I thought that the bag was quite pricey for a lb $4.6. I looked even more and found the rejected fortune cookies or the failed ones which are shaped in a funny way but half the price! It was $1.95 instead of the $4 bag. It tasted pretty good but is quite addicting so watch out! I recommend this place for fortune cookies. Haven't tried other cookies.
author: Stevie C.

description: This place has the best fortune cookies ever! Even the mis-shaped ones are tasty. If you guys are ever at Chinatown walking around, stop by this place and buy a bag or two.
author: Spooky B.

description:
A quick Google yielded Mee Mee as THE source for cow ears.  I don't even want to think about what those poor cows* had to go through so we could feast on those delicious yellow and brown swirls of crunchy addictiveness.  Since my mommy told me to bring me back some of those cow ear cookies from San Fran, dutiful daughter that I am, I smuggled 4 bags ($3.50 each -- earfuls and earfuls!) back across the state border.  Ya gotta be careful about spreading that nasty mad cow ear disease, but a little crunch-crunch never hurt anyone.  Especially when helpful ladies ring up my order in Chinese and conveniently repeat in English for my non-Chinese boyfriend.  The store isn't much to look at and it's not a cafe setup, so grab your cow ears and run.  I was so hellbent on my stash that I didn't really scope out the other stock, but it seems they have a novelty-esque selection of Chinese baked goods, like giant fortune cookies and rainbow flavors of Chinese-style treats.  It's worth a gander.  (3.5 stars)
*this is a lie.
author: Andrea L.

description: all i have to say is the best fortune cookies ever!!!
author: Stella W.

description: I love this place!  The wole staff (owners/husband and wife) were very sweet to me.  I had custom made fortune cookies printed for me.  Very reasonable prices and very fresh cookies.  They were a hit at my party.
author: Kattya B.

description:
watching the machines in the back was the highlight.
small, flat mixed flavored cookies nice and crisp but not addicting like i'd thought they'd be
author: Rob C.

description: My favorite place for simple butter cookies. And fortune cookies, especially the coin-size ones. Like eating donut holes, but with the leftover fortune cookie dough. They also have sesame cookies, "cow ears" (not as weird as that sounds) and other pastries. The only drawback was the impatient  rude cashier --- instead of soup nazi, this is fortune cookie nazi??? Better know what you want before she huffs and puffs and moves onto the next customer!
author: Lulubelle L.

description:
omgosh i use to come here when i was in elementary school to buy my field trip lunches (well more like my mom made my brother trek 2 blocks 7/8 in the morn for my meals...but hey i was like in first grade!) yes i hads buns for lunch while everyone else had sandwiches and lunchables.... but at least i always had a squeezit to drink..not a loser no not me..i saved my mom lots on lunch!

thier buns were so cheap... like 4 for $1.00, but it definitely whet up by now..... the place aways smells of delicious fortune cookies.... and the best mini muffins i've ever had!
author: Lynn T.

description: LOVE the walnut cookies (the small rectangular ones). MUST return to try other cookies too.  Their mooncakes looked good.
author: Frankie G.

description: I randomly stopped in Mee Mee Bakery after some pink fortune cookies in the window caught my eye. I thought to myself, "aren't these cute?" and to my delight, discovered that they were strawberry flavored! I decided to pick up a small mixed bag which included 5 fortune cookies. The strawberry flavor was by far my favorite. It had a nice subtle taste. The chocolate fortune cookie could have had a bit more cocoa flavor for my liking, but then again, I am a bit of a chocoholic! I will definitely be back again to pick up some fortune cookies which you can have personalized as well, which would be a cute idea for a wedding shower or baby shower.
author: Kelli P.

description: My friend introduced me to this place. It was great! She told me how her family used to buy the cheaper bag full of "reject fortune cookies" which is what I ended up buying. The cookies taste so good, fresh, and not stale. And since I wasn't giving them out, I was just eating them at home, I didn't mind eating rejects. Loved the history that the store had been around for such a long time.
author: Vivian L.

description: Authentic fortune cookies! Chocolate Bon-Bons, Almond Macoroons! MMmmmm....so good! Everytime my family comes to Chinatown, we always stop by here after eating dim sum. I love their chocolate bon-bons..a really good chewy meringue-type cookie, their cheap "irregular" fortune cookies...and best of all, the marzipan infused strongest strong almond flavored macaroons...soo good!! I love this place because its full of so much history...(you can see all the memorablia on the walls)...plus everything is fresh because its all made Right there!...the only downside is that the price on the cookies are quite pricey..about $8/lb. The fortune cookies however don't cost a fortune..about $3/bag
author: Jessica h.

description: I remember I used to always love coming here as a kid . I've always loved their fortune cookies and cow ear cookies . They're always fresh and delicious ! Their mini pound cakes are really good too ! But don't get their multi-colored fortune cookies - they taste really weird .
author: Eileen L.

description: I was here on Saturday, and have been in here a few times before, very worthy of a yelp. They sell fortune cookies in a few different flavors (strawberry, chocolate, coffee, and regular), and they also sell the fortune cookies as flattened out chips (not in the fortune shapes). This store front is small and there is an assembly line in the back where they mass produce the cookies...often you will see the one guy working back there to do everything himself...his wife works the cash register. We picked up a few bags of different flavors of the flat cookies for everybody in may family, good stuff, everybody likes them...
author: Anthony L.

description: bought 6 bags of fortune cookies for a party; 3 bags were stale. I complained, and they had the nerve to ask back for the stale ones before they would reimburse me!! How unprofessional and rude is that?!! First of all, Hello?! why would i keep stale ones? Of course I had tossed it in anger! I am very disappointed and disgusted with this bakery! I recommend nobody take a chance there, especially if you plan to give these as gifts. Not worth paying even $1 for!
author: Joanna Y.
